term.title: photon exitance

item.text: Photon flux, number basis, qp, emitted by an element of the surface containing the source point under consideration divided by the area S of that element. SI unit is s-1 m-2.

notes.item: Mathematical definition: dq(p)/dS. If qp is constant over the surface area considered, Mp = qp/S.

This quantity can be expressed on a chemical amount basis by dividing Mp by the Avogadro constant. In this case the symbol is Mn,p, the name 'photon exitance, amount basis', SI unit is mol s-1 m-2; common unit is einstein s-1 m-2.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 394 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
